segment.tokens: asked Little Joe Otter his eyes bright with interest
We are holding a session of school here today
Hold up one of your feet
though there was a funny puzzled look on his face
I never could swim the way
you swim better than Paddy the Beaver ”
I would go hungry most of the time
“ Paddy does n't live on fish
I can catch a fish in a tail-end race , and that 's going some . ”
Little Joe slipped into the water
The Smiling Pool was very still
the little people could look right down
the little people see nearly to the bottom
he then saw little more than a brown streak
A second later his head popped out on the other side of the Smiling Pool
“ You would n't stand much chance with Little Joe around
Like Billy Mink Little Joe is a great especially up down the Laughing Brook the Big River
that traveling on land is slow
When he does cross from one stream or pond to another
he always picks out the smoothest going
Sometimes in winter he travels quite a bit
when he comes to a smooth hill
Then he slides down it on his stomach
I 've got one down the Laughing Brook where the bank is steep
What do you mean by a slippery slide
Happy Jack Squirrel was sitting in the Big Hickory-tree which grew on the bank of the Smiling Pool
the Big Hickory-tree grew on the bank of the Smiling Pool
“ Little Joe Otter his family are quite as of play as any of my children
“ They get a lot of fun of life
One of their ways of playing is to make a slippery slide the bank the water deep
where the bank is the water deep
In winter it is made of snow
in summer it is made of mud
There splash into the water the bank it
In winter they make their slippery slide
where the water does n't freeze
they get just as much fun in winter
that Little Joe does n't sleep in winter
“ I should say not ” exclaimed Little Joe
I have such a warm coat that I never cold
where the water does n't freeze
I can swim for long distances under ice and so I can always get plenty of food . ”
so I can always get plenty of food
“ Once in a while I like a little fresh meat for a change , and sometimes when fish are scarce I eat Frogs , but I prefer fish , especially Salmon and Trout . ”
while I like a little fresh meat for a change sometimes
I prefer fish especially Salmon Trout
How many babies do you have at a time
” replied Little Joe “ only one family a year
They are born in my comfortable house , which is a burrow in the bank
my comfortable house is a in the bank
There Mrs. Otter makes a large soft nest of leaves and grass
I will go on up the Laughing Brook
Mrs. Otter is waiting for me up there ”
Old Mother Nature told Little Joe to go ahead
“ I 'm very of Little Joe Otter
That fur coat of his is
man is forever hunting him for it
The Otters were once numerous over this great country
that the day is n't far away
when there will be no Little Joe
There are two other members of the Weasel family
these like Little Joe and Billy Mink are continually being hunted for their fur coats
I will tell you about them to-morrow . ”
